ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate from lifted balls of food. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat from a lifted ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.4_0: One should not eat from a lifted ball of food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats from a lifted ball of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.15_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.16_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
